Key Match Events: The match was abandoned due to rain after 10 overs.
Scotland scored 90-0 in 10 overs with George Munsey scoring 45 not out and Michael Jones scoring 41 not out.
England only managed to take one wicket in Scotland's 10 overs, and that was a no-ball.
Post-Match Reflections: Scotland captain Richie Berrington: 'Everyone's frustrated, but some positives to take at least.'
England captain Jos Buttler: 'We expected a tough challenge, there are no easy games, but we were confident coming into the game.'
Nikhil Uttamchandani: 'This group is now wide open. Teams will be on the notice that there are no easy games in this World Cup.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was delayed due to rain and eventually abandoned after 10 overs.
Scotland's batting performance was praised, especially considering the stop-start nature of the innings.
England's target of 109 from 10 overs was deemed doable by Scotland's captain Richie Berrington.
